stories.title: Land sale threatens public access in the Michigan's U.P

stories.text:
I am sure this is a problem on all social media. But it is something I find annoying on Youtube and Spotify, as far as I have noticed.

Both the platforms keep recommending content based on my previous likes. Even when I am trying to find something new, the search results keep returning things similar to my historical views.

I open the sites using a VPN, search, find some new things, and watch/listen to it in my primary account.

But that is tedious and does not change the recommendation fast. It still takes ages to change.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you break out of an algo silo on sites like YouTube and Spotify
